quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So if something happens to me tomorrow, the record just proves they ignored me.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: Yes, and that’s why it’s vital to keep it consistent, so the failures are visible.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Visible after the fact doesn’t stop it happening.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I understand, Ben. I’ll keep pressing them on the urgent side too.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: It feels like I’m being left to prove they failed, instead of being protected.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and that’s not how it should be.

contradictions.issue: Victim highlights being left to prove failure vs. advocate admits this is wrong but offers no immediate remedy
